column1:
Aryan Khan will be released from the Arthur Road jail today. He was granted
bail by the Bombay High Court on Thursday in the Mumbai drug bust case.
column2:
The Bombay High Court on Friday refused to quash the summonses issued by the
Enforcement Directorate to former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in
a case of alleged money laundering and corruption.
column3:
The cumulative number of Covid-19 vaccine doses administered in the country
crossed 105 crore on Friday, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said in
a tweet.
column4:
Abu Sufiyan, an alleged operative of the al-Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent,
has been booked for his involvement in a conspiracy for furthering the
activities of the banned terrorist organisation in India.
column5:
Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala demanded on Friday that PM Modi
apologise to the country and the Supreme Court for blocking Delhi's borders
and causing inconvenience to people.
column6:
Five persons have died and several others fell ill after consuming liquor in
Muzaffarpur district of Bihar, where total prohibition is in place for more
than five years.
column7:
The Supreme Court said that it cannot play with the lives of people by
directing the Centre to revaccinate people with Covishield who are fully
vaccinated with Covaxin to enable them to travel abroad.
column8:
Army chief General MM Naravane said that at the National Defence Academy
(NDA), which recently opened its doors to women, the training of women cadets
will be at par with that of men.
column9:
Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday asserted that a BJP victory in next
year’s Uttar Pradesh assembly polls will lay the foundation for the 2024
Lok Sabha elections.
column10:
The Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) rescued a 23-year-old woman who was
being taken to Jharkhand by her parents to forcibly marry her off.
column11:
Over 400 school students and 50 teachers in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra
district have tested positive for Covid-19 in the last month.
column12:
Union Minister Jitendra Singh launched India's first manned ocean mission,
"Samudrayan," in Chennai on Friday.
column13:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited the Piazza Gandhi in Rome on Friday to
pay tribute to Mahatma Gandhi. He also interacted with a group of Indians
there, who greeted him in Gujarati.
column14:
The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has registered a case against a
Gujarat-based firm for defrauding banks to the tune of Rs 114 crore.
column15:
Industries like natural gas, refinery products and cement recorded a healthy
performance.
column16:
Plastic bags containing country-made bombs were recovered near the
Indo-Bangla border in Malda on Friday.
column17:
Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharman met with her counterparts in Singapore and
Canada on Friday to discuss opportunities for collaboration.
column18:
A minute-by-minute account of how procedural delays at the Mumbai sessions
court and Aryan Khan's legal team missing the deadline to drop the release
writ led to Shah Rukh Khan's son spending another night in jail.
column19:
As many as 48 candidates are in the fray in four constituencies where
straight fights are expected between the ruling BJP and the opposition
Congress.
column20:
A Twitter user shared this video with the caption, “This is Tripura Police.
Leading the rioters to burn Muslims' houses, mosques and their shops, with
their slogans. #SaveTripuraMuslim #TripuraAntiMuslimsRiots.”
column21:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday held the first in-person meeting with
his Italian counterpart Mario Draghi in Rome and held extensive talks on
diversifying the bilateral ties.
column22:
The university administration said that the event – titled “Gendered
Resistance and Fresh Challenges in Post-2019 Kashmir” – had been planned
without permission.
column23:
A special court in Mumbai on Friday allowed Mumbai Police to take custody of
dismissed police officer Sachin Waze in an extortion case.
column24:
As leaders of more than 120 countries gear up for the 26th Conference of
Parties (COP26), the next annual UN climate change conference, to be held in
Glasgow from October 31 to November 12, we raise these questions: Are we
really in a climate change? Is the core problem with the western world? What
can India really do? What's the one big solution for next 10 years? Is
net-zero carbon emissions target by 2050 realistic?
column25:
The Samyukta Kisan Morcha will hold an internal meeting on Saturday to
discuss what to do after the Delhi Police removed the barricades at the
Ghazipur and Tikri border protest sites.
column26:
NCB said it tried to speak with Sail and requested the Mumbai police
commissioner to help as there were reports in the media that he was in
contact with police and they were examining him.
column27:
The school principal who allegedly hung a child upside down from the balcony
on the first floor of a building has been arrested after photographs of the
incident went viral on social media.
column28:
Maharashtra environment minister Aaditya Thackeray said India needs to
de-carbonise rapidly in transport and energy sectors to fight the climate
crisis.
column29:
In an exclusive interview with India Today, Maharashtra Environment Minister
Aaditya Thackeray said that there is a climate emergency and the time to
act is now.
column30:
The minimum temperature in Delhi on Friday was recorded at 14 degrees
Celsius.
column31:
After removing barricades and barbed wires from farmers' protest sites,
Delhi Police said that it wanted to “create a positive atmosphere” for
people who had been “facing a lot of problems”.
column32:
The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached assets worth Rs 2.62 crore of a
Bihar-based builder in connection with a money laundering case.
column33:
The chopper was seized in Chennai the investigation of a case registered by
the US Department of Homeland Security over its alleged end-use in a
prohibited country.
column34:
Sasikala began her tour by garlanding the statues of Pasumpon Muthuramalinga
Thevar and Marudhu Pandiyar in Madurai.
column35:
Bengaluru liquor shops have been ordered shut till October 31 as a
precautionary measure after Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar passed away on
Friday.
column36:
Indian Army on Friday granted Permanent Commission (PC) to its thirty-nine
women officers, it said in a statement.
column37:
"In particular, carbon emissions have to be stopped," CM Yogi Adityanath said
at the Uttar Pradesh Climate Change Conference.
column38:
The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached property worth Rs 74 crore in
Dehradun of former Uttar Pradesh BSP MLC Mohd Iqbal in a money laundering
case.
column39:
On Friday, Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik claimed that he made public the
photographs of NCB officer Sameer Wankhede's first wife with her prior
consent.
column40:
The Delhi Assembly's Peace and Harmony committee has asked Facebook India to
send a senior representative to depose before it on November 2 in north east
Delhi riots case.
column41:
Photos of a woman crying with a child and men carrying burnt copies of the
Quran are being circulated with the claim that they are from a recent unrest
in Tripura. India Today Anti Fake News War Room has found that the claim
along with the images is misleading.
column42:
Tamil Nadu government officials raised the spillway shutters 3 and 4 of the
126-year old dam by 0.3 metres.
column43:
Rahul Gandhi appeared before a magistrate's court in Surat to record his
statement in a criminal defamation case filed against him.
column44:
India and Israel will form a task force for ten-year plan on defence
cooperation, the defence ministry said in a statement on Friday.
column45:
The Rome Summit is the 16th G20 gathering at the level of Heads of states and
governments.
column46:
Aryan Khan won't be released from Mumbai's Arthur Road jail today as his exit
formalities required for the release were delayed by his legal team.
column47:
The Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) on Friday allowed full-seating
capacity in cinema halls, theatres and multiplexes.
column48:
India on Friday extended the suspension of scheduled international flights
till November 30. Restrictions will, however, not apply to international
all-cargo operations flights approved by DGCA.
column49:
The Chandigarh Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission has fined a Manali
Hotel and a travel firm to the tune of Rs 27,000 for cheating two honeymoon
couples.
column50:
The Defence Research and Development Organisation and the Indian Air Force
successfully flight-tested a Long Range Bomb on Friday.
column51:
“These transfers for political expediency could further affect the
investigations and need for justice in this barbaric massacre of
peacefully-protesting farmers," SKM stated.
column52:
Two women drowned as a raft overturned in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district
on Friday.
column53:
The Assam government has set a target of completing Covid-19 vaccination
of the state's eligible population by January 15 next year, said Chief
Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Friday.
column54:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid floral tributes at the bust of Mahatma
Gandhi in Rome on Friday.
column55:
Aryan Khan will have to spend another night in Mumbai's Arthur Road jail as
his legal team missed the 5:30 pm deadline for paperwork.
column56:
Union Home Minister Amit Shah said Yogi Adityanath has to become CM in 2022
for Narendra Modi to be sworn in as the prime minister again in 2024.
column57:
Trinamool Congress supremo Mamata Banerjee, on a visit to Goa where polls are
due next year, said her party is national and its initials -- TMC -- stand
for temple, mosque and church.
column58:
A copy of the five-page operative order was signed by Justice N W Sambre on
Friday afternoon.
column59:
Amid Khela Hobe chants, Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee interacted
with the fishermen community of Goa on Thursday.
column60:
Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said the state government has sent a dossier to
the Centre seeking a ban on Popular Front of India (PFI) and Campus Front of
India (CFI).
column61:
According to data from State Bank of India (SBI), political parties received
funds worth Rs 614 crore from donors through electoral bonds in October.
column62:
Schools will reopen for students of Class 9-12 on November 16. Local trains
have been allowed to operate at 50% capacity.
column63:
"At the time of arrival to the emergency, the patient [Puneeth Rajkumar] was
non-responsive and was in cardiac asystole," the hospital said in a
statement.
column64:
The Bombay High Court has released a five-page order after granting Aryan
Khan bail in the Mumbai cruise drugs case on Thursday. As per the order,
Aryan cannot leave India without permission from the NDPS court.
column65:
Bollywood actor Juhi Chawla signed Rs 1 lakh bail bond for Aryan Khan's
release.
column66:
Telangana Labour minister Malla Reddy handed over Rs 1.75 to Sri Lakshmi
Narasimha Swamy temple in Yadadri for the gold plating work of Vimana
Gopuram.
column67:
Speaking to India Today TV, Fashion TV India MD Kashiff Khan denied that the
company had anything to do with organising the rave party aboard the Cordelia
cruise ship. He claimed that FTV was a sponsor for the party, and not the
organiser. Responding to allegations made by NCP’s Nawab Malik, Kashiff
Khan said, “I have never been associated with any kind of drugs, any
substances, any pornography in the past.”
column68:
Punjab election 2022: With its poll slogan, 'Nava Punjab Bhajpa De Naal',
here's how the BJP is trying to woo the Punjabis voters, particularly the
Sikh community.
column69:
NCP leader Nawab Malik on Friday tweeted a video of Fashion TV Managing
Director Kashiff Khan dancing on the Cordelia cruise. Nawab Malik questioned
why no action was initiated against Kashiff Khan, who allegedly organised the
rave party on Mumbai cruise ship on October 2.
column70:
Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj S Bommai expressed his condolences on the
death of actor Puneeth Rajkumar, saying that his death is an enormous loss
for the state.
column71:
Power Star Puneeth Rajkumar died after suffering a heart attack on Friday. He
will be cremated with full state honours on Sunday and his fans will be able
to bid final goodbye to him at the Kanteerava Studios in Bengaluru.
column72:
The stage is all set for Aryan Khan's release as the Bombay High Court today
released a 5-page bail order.
column73:
The Andhra Pradesh government is constructing digital libraries in its
villages. CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has asked officials to ensure that the
digital libraries are equipped with uninterrupted bandwidth.
column74:
Showkat Ganie, 25, was among three engineering students from Kashmir who were
arrested in Agra.
column75:
Popular Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar died after suffering a heart attack on
Friday morning. PM Narendra Modi, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and many other
political leaders condoled the sudden demise of Puneeth Rajkumar.
column76:
Scores of fans of Power Star Puneeth Rajkumar have gathered outside the
Vikram Hospital in Bengaluru. The actor passed away at the age of 46 on
Friday after suffering a heart attack.
column77:
The Bombay High Court released a detailed bail order in the Mumbai cruise
drugs case on Friday, setting the stage for Aryan Khan's release from Arthur
Road jail.
column78:
Power Star Puneeth Rajkumar, who passed away at the age of 46 on Friday, had
made a contribution of Rs 50 lakh towards the Karnataka CM Relief fund last
year to help the state in its fight against Covid-19.
column79:
Power Star Puneeth Rajkumar passed away at the age of 46. The Karnataka
government issued a high alert after the news broke, according to reports.
column80:
Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai has reached Vikram Hospital in
Bengaluru where Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar was admitted after he suffered
a heart attack.
column81:
Ahead of next year’s assembly polls in Uttar Pradesh, Union Home Minister
Amit Shah on Friday launched `Mera Parivaar-BJP Parivaar` membership drive in
Lucknow. Addressing a rally, Amit Shah said; "Today I can proudly say that
Yogi Ji and his team have fulfilled 90% of the promises that we made in our
2017 manifesto. I want to say to Yogi Ji to march towards 100% target in
upcoming months so that people can believe that BJP fulfils whatever it
says."
column82:
Aryan Khan's case has brought into the limelight the drugs and narcotics
trade in India. Has India messed up its fight against drugs? Read to know.
column83:
Nearly 7.97 lakh voters will decide the fate of 31 candidates in the upcoming
bye-elections for the five Assam assembly seats that are to be held on
October 30.

The seventh frigate of the Indian Navy was launched at Yantar Shipyard in
Russia's Kaliningrad on Thursday. The ship was formally named as ''Tushil'',
which means protector shield in Sanskrit.

A police sub-inspector in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar was booked for
allegedly getting the job on forged documents.

Ellenabad bypolls will witness a triangular contest in the upcoming bypolls.
INLD's Abhay Singh Chautala is eyeing a hat-trick as he will be contesting
his third bypoll.

Tennis veteran Leander Paes has joined the Trinamool Congress (TMC). Party
supremo Mamata Banerjee made the announcement on Friday.

Once a thriving place for firecracker manufacturers, the city of Sivakasi in

as several states announce ban on firecrackers.
column89:
Amid allegations that the ruling TRS and Opposition BJP distributed money
ahead of bypolls in Telangana, voters on Friday took to streets demanding
money from CM K Chandrashekar Rao's party. The Congress has asked the
Election Commission to cancel bypolls.
column90:
Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik called the cruise drugs case a
conspiracy by BJP to move "Bollywood out of Mumbai" and alluded to the
recent meetings of Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath with film
personalities over the setting up of a film city in Noida.
"The Mumbai cruise drugs case is nothing but BJP's bid to move Bollywood out
of Maharashtra. It is a conspiracy by BJP to defame Bollywood," Nawab Malik
said while addressing a press conference.
column91:
Tamil Nadu MLA T Velmurugan said the influx of people from other states in
Tamil Nadu will rob the natives of opportunities at work and in trade. This
might even bring about change in the culture here, he said.

BJP MP Varun Gandhi said farmers would continue to be exploited in mandis
till there is no legal guarantee for MSPs of crops.
column93:
The Delhi Police has started clearing roads, removing the barricades and
concertina wires it had put in place at the Ghazipur border. The police had
installed multiple layers of iron and cement barricades, and at least five
layers of concertina wires in the wake of the January 26 violence during the
farmers’ protest against the three contentious farm laws.
column94:
In a fresh swipe at Sameer Wankhede, Nawab Malik said the NCB officer moved
the Bombay High Court seeking protection from arrest as he was "afraid".
"Sameer Wankhede approached the Bombay High Court requesting a restraining
order against Mumbai police from arresting him. He had approached Mumbai
police last week requesting protection. He must have done something really
wrong and that is why he is afraid of action against him," Nawab Malik
further said.

release from jail.

at Ghazipur border. Protesting farmers continue to occupy a stretch on the

Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan was granted bail by the
Bombay High Court on Thursday in connection with the Mumbai cruise drugs

detailed order today (Friday).

Prime Minister Narendra Modi reached Rome today (Friday) to attend the G20
Summit. PM Modi has said that in Rome he would hold discussions on the global
economic situation and recovery from the Covid-19 pandemic. Modi will be
visiting Rome and the Vatican City from October 29-31 in what is the first
visit by an Indian PM in almost 12 years.

Nawab Malik referred to the recent meeting of Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister

Israel's new envoy to India, Naor Gilon, has said that one of the major

will be visiting Rome and the Vatican City from October 29-31 and later
travel to the UK.

“The spread of terrorism in Africa, as evident from the challenges we face

employment before the Covid-19 crisis but making up 47.6 per cent of
